page.title: 01Gazetteer - Central London
page.content: This is a large part of Visitors' London, the block containing what the tourist sees as the heart of London. Marylebone, Mayfair, St James's, St Pancras, Holborn, Soho, and the West End are here, in parts of the boroughs of Westminster and Camden. Famous streets include Oxford Street, The Strand, Piccadilly, Fleet Street, Bond Street, Regent Street, The Embankment and High Holborn. There are many squares such as Trafalgar Square. Famous buildings include Euston and St Pancras Stations, Royal Festival Hall, National Gallery, Mme Tussauds, The Inns of Court, Royal Academy, Old Bailey, Broadcasting House, University of London.Riches indeed which would take a whole videodisc to describe. Not just a tourist attraction, however, but with all the problems of a major city-old buildings, pollution.
